arts.ttl: Tottenham fight back to snatch late draw at Brighton
arts.sum: A late own goal from Jan Paul van Hecke secured Tottenham a point at Brighton as the away side fought back from 2-0 down to draw 2-2 at the American Express Stadium.

arts.ttl: Van Hecke own goal completes Tottenham fightback as Brighton blow two-goal lead
arts.athr: John Brewin at the Amex Stadium
arts.sum: Familiar failings from Tottenham, proof that a change of management can never immediately cure previous ills. There is, though, a fighting spirit within Thomas Frank‚Äôs new Spurs, whereas last season in the Premier League, there was rarely much beyond surrender. Brighton scored two fine first-half goals, Yankuba Minteh‚Äôs solo mission followed by an opportunistic long-range strike from Yasin Ayari, in a 45 minutes where Tottenham dominated possession but repeatedly left open the door. arts.ttl: Watch the own goal that puts Spurs back in contention against Brighton
arts.sum: The second own goal for Tottenham in a week, but own goals come through pressure. After the game, Thomas Frank needs to explain why he dropped Zavi Simons, who was an immediate and positive influence, from his first touch.
